meanings.definition: A heap of combustibles for burning a dead body as a funeral rite.
meanings.sent1: The villagers gathered around the pyres to bid farewell to their loved ones.
meanings.sent2: The funeral procession solemnly approached the pyres where the deceased would be cremated.
meanings.sent3: As the pyres crackled with flames, the mourners shared stories of the departed.
meanings.sent4: The pyres stood tall like silent sentinels, carrying the spirits of the departed to the heavens.
meanings.sent5: The flickering flames of the pyres painted the night sky with an orange glow.

meanings.definition: A pile of wood or other combustible material for burning a corpse as a funeral rite.
meanings.sent1: The pyres were carefully constructed to ensure a proper cremation ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The crackling sound of the pyres echoed through the night as the funeral rites began.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played hide-and-seek around the pyres, unaware of their significance.
meanings.sent4: The pyres blazed brightly, sending smoke signals to the ancestors in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the pyres comforted the grieving family members in the cold night.

meanings.definition: A pile of combustible materials for burning a dead body as a funeral rite.
meanings.sent1: The pyres were lit at dusk, marking the beginning of the sacred funeral ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The villagers gathered dry branches and leaves to build the pyres for the cremation.
meanings.sent3: The crackling of the pyres sounded like a chorus of tiny fireworks celebrating a life well-lived.
meanings.sent4: The flames of the pyres danced in the wind, carrying the soul of the departed on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The glow of the pyres illuminated the faces of the mourners, reflecting both sorrow and acceptance.
